summary: Parent workflow gets stuck in running state when starting a child workflow fails due to the child workflow ID already existing. The parent workflow should either complete or fail, but instead remains indefinitely in running state until timeout.
userImpact: Workflows become stuck indefinitely when attempting to start a child workflow with a duplicate ID, requiring manual intervention or timeout to resolve.
rootCause: The workflow engine does not properly handle START_CHILD_WORKFLOW_EXECUTION_FAILED events, leaving the parent workflow in an incomplete state instead of transitioning to completed or failed status.
keyQuote: Workflow instance will stuck at running, and the last event is WorkflowTaskCompleted until it timeout.
